Dgame.Math.Vector3



struct Vector3(T) if (isNumeric!T);
Vector3 is a structure that defines a three-dimensional point.

Author:
Randy Schuett

T x;
The x coordinate

T y;
The y coordinate

T z;
The z coordinate

pure nothrow this(T x, T y, T z = 0);
CTor

pure nothrow this(U)(U x, U y, U z = 0) if (isNumeric!U && !is(U : T));
CTor

pure nothrow this(U)(ref const Vector3!U vec) if (!is(U : T));
CTor

const pure nothrow @nogc bool opEquals(ref const Vector3!T vec);
Compares two vectors by checking whether the coordinates are equals.

const pure nothrow @nogc bool isEmpty();
Checks if this vector is empty. This means that his coordinates are 0.

const pure nothrow @nogc float scalar(ref const Vector3!T vec);
Calculate the scalar product.

alias dot = scalar;
alias for scalar

const pure nothrow @nogc @property float length();
Calculate the length.

const pure nothrow @nogc float diff(ref const Vector3!T vec);
Calculate the diff between two vectors.

pure nothrow @nogc ref Vector3!T opOpAssign(string op)(ref const Vector3!T vec);
Supported operation: +=, -=, *=, /= and %=

pure nothrow @nogc ref Vector3!T opOpAssign(string op)(T num);
Supported operation: +=, -=, *=, /= and %=

const pure nothrow @nogc Vector3!T opBinary(string op)(ref const Vector3!T vec);
Supported operation: +, -, *, / and %

const pure @nogc Vector3!T opBinary(string op)(T num);
Supported operation: +, -, *, / and %

const pure nothrow @nogc Vector3!T cross(ref const Vector3!T vec);
Returns the cross product of this and another Vector.

const pure nothrow Vector3f normalize();
Normalize the vector in which the coordinates are divided by the length.

const pure nothrow Vector3f rotate(float angle, ref const Vector3!T rot);
Rotate the current Vector by an angle and rotation Vector and returns the result

alias Vector3f = Vector3!float.Vector3;
A float representation
